meanings.definition: Make (a bill or other proposal) law.
meanings.sent1: The president is enacting a new law to protect the environment.
meanings.sent2: The congress is enacting a bill to improve healthcare for all citizens.
meanings.sent3: The mayor accidentally ended up enacting a law that required everyone to wear silly hats on Fridays.
meanings.sent4: By enacting this law, we are building a stronger foundation for our society.
meanings.sent5: Enacting this bill will ensure a brighter future for generations to come.

meanings.definition: Perform or represent (a scene, play, or skit).
meanings.sent1: The students are enacting a play about friendship and kindness.
meanings.sent2: The actors are enacting a thrilling scene from the famous movie.
meanings.sent3: The children had a blast enacting a funny skit at the school talent show.
meanings.sent4: She was enacting the role of a brave warrior with passion and dedication.
meanings.sent5: Enacting a scene requires creativity and good acting skills.

meanings.sent1: The new policy will be enacting next month to improve efficiency.
meanings.sent2: The company is enacting changes to its work schedule for better productivity.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be enacting a plan to steal treats from the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Enacting these new rules will lead to a more organized workplace.
meanings.sent5: Enacting the safety measures promptly saved many lives during the emergency.
